title: How were mongols trained to be soldiers? - Quora

response.answer_text: HANDLING HORSES FOR 24/7 There is a saying “Mongol born on a horse dies on a horse’’, children start riding horses before they start walking. Mongol horses are semi wild. Some herders can have 100–150 horses. Handling them for 24/7, taming horses for a whole summer can be the most toughest physical training ever.  Only children competes in Mongolian horse racing. Horse racing is not an easy job let along for children. Unlike Western horse racing, which consists of short sprints generally not much longer than 2 km, Mongolian horse racing as featured in Naadam is a cross-country event, with races 15–30 km long. Children from 5 to 13 are chosen as jockeys and train in the months preceding the races.  Mongolian boy after winter horse racing. HUNTING AND ARCHERY. Mongolian boys and girls raised to be tough. Hunting and archery were taught at early age. Seven year old boy can be told not to cry and man up. Boys and men train their archery and hunting skills while herding, just for fun and to test their abilities. About Mongolian hunting rules you may read here How ecologically conscious are Mongolians?  MONGOLIAN WRESTLING. Mongolian boys had not many toys to play, instead they grow up wrestling. Mongolian wrestling - Wikipedia  Mongolian children help their parents with livestock and herding at early age, there is another saying “Love inside but do not show it outside” meaning don't show your love to your children they might get spoiled and get too dependant on you. Because of warrior culture and history many children could be left orphaned. They needed to be independent,self sufficient and ready to survive under any circumstances.

i have read the various accounts alleging how the Mongol Army was trained but wonder what is the source of this information? was a vault of Mongol Horde training manuals or films recently uncovered? has the Mongol equivalent of Sandhurst or West Point been unearthed? one might ask given the glowing accounts of the Mongol’s training, discipline and other virtues why the Army degraded so quickly? 57 years after Genghis Khan’s death the Mongol force attacking Hungary in 1285 was annihilated. a year later the Mongols were routed in Poland. the Mongols Never posed a serious threat to those countries or Europe again. what happened to the vaunted Mongol war machine? as time went on the Mongol Army was regularly defeated but what had changed? did they forget how to fight or finally just come up against competent military opponents? could it be the prowess of the Mongols is just a myth? certainly once the Mongols were crushed they never ever became a military threat to any civilized nations but life on the steppe had hardly changed since Genghis Khan's time. the thing that had changed is civilized societies were no longer easy targets for a bunch of horse riding thugs. the Industrial Revolution sealed the nomads fate. Railways and repeating rifles allowed sedentary peoples to penetrate even the most wild and remote areas and conquer even the most determined and fierce of nomadic warriors. in the end the Mongols like other nomads couldn’t even defend themselves.
